intro: Aspidium reptans var. cordatum, commonly known as the heart-shaped maidenhair fern, is a variant of the common maidenhair fern. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped fronds that are finely divided and delicate in appearance. The plant belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is native to regions in Asia, including China and Japan. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
